page.title: 02Population and Settlement
page.content: Following typical settlement patterns found in much of Cornwall, farms are {scattered}around the landscape, for the most part within the curtilage of their own land. Only{two hamlets}have developed: St Minver in the north west and Amble in the south east. And while the economic backbone of the block is still as it always has been,{mixed} {farming,}since 1945{tourism}has played an increasingly important part. Co_incidentally, full_time labour requirements on such farms have been reduced to such an extent that the survey found hardly any examples in 1985 of an agricultural labourer. However there were over 20 people in seasonal or full_time tourist_linked employment. The majority of the inhabitants are{car owners}who have to travel out of the block for work, school and most of their shopping.
